div1.p: Hench discusses available yellow fever records.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R.H. Brooke, January 6, 1942
div1.opener:
File not and
CCC 201 (Hench, P.S.)
January 6, 1942
Mr. R. H. Brooke, Chief Clerk
War Department
Office of the Surgeon General
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Brooke:
div1.p:
I am delighted with your reply of January 1,
saying that the yellow fever records of Walter Reed and
his colleagues will be available for me at the National
Archives. I will get in touch with you shortly after
my arrival.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
